data.Name: Fully Saturated
data.Description: Refers to a condition where the pores of the sample are completely filled with fluid, allowing for the measurement of total porosity and fluid properties using NMR techniques.

data.Name: Partially Saturated
data.Description: Indicates a state where only a portion of the sampleâ€™s pore space is filled with fluid, useful for studying fluid distribution, wettability, and capillary forces within the porous medium.

data.Name: Residual
data.Description: Describes the condition where only the residual amount of fluid remains in the pore spaces after drainage or production processes, important for understanding irreducible water or oil saturation levels.

data.Name: Fresh State
data.Description: Refers to the original, unaltered condition of the sample, typically before any fluid introduction or saturation, providing a baseline for subsequent NMR measurements and comparisons.
